readMDTable 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

readMDTable

readMDTable converts raw markdown tables from a string, file, or URL to tibbles.

Many sites (like GitHub) convert markdown tables into HTML tables. For these types of tables you’re probably better off using rvest.

Installation

Install from GitHub:

devtools::install_github("jrdnbradford/readMDTable")

License

GPL >= 3.

Docs

Review the package index reference or use

?readMDTable

for documentation.

Example

Read in an example markdown table from the package:

mtcars_file <- read_md_table_example("mtcars.md")

The raw markdown table:

cat(readLines(mtcars_file), sep = "\n")
## |model              |mpg |cyl|disp |hp |drat|wt   |qsec |vs |am |gear|carb|
## |-------------------|----|---|-----|---|----|-----|-----|---|---|----|----|

After reading it in:

read_md_table(mtcars_file)
## Rows: 32 Columns: 12
## ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## Delimiter: "|"
## chr  (1): model
## dbl (11): mpg, cyl, disp, hp, drat, wt, qsec, vs, am, gear, carb

##  2 Mazda RX4 …  21       6  160    110  3.9   2.88  17.0     0     1     4     4
